availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John A.W. Smith (Green County, Kentucky, farmer and farmhand.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and farmhand. Green County, Kentucky, native. Married to Martha A. Robinson Smith. Father of Thomas Smith, Mary E. Smith, William Smith, Lucy U. Smith, Samuel W. Smith, and Benjamin Smith. Married to Martha T. Hopkins Smith in Green County, Kentucky, in August 1855. Father of Robert H. Smith, Charles B. Smith, and Fannie J. Smith. Farmer in Green County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Farmhand in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 116B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 561.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Precinct 2, p. 443B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Green County Deaths.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film 000594645.
"John Absalom Waller Smith (1812-1891)," Find A Grave, Memorial 70048139, accessed February 22, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/70048139.
